ocr_training.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 import cv2
2 import numpy as np
3 
4 # training
5 samples = np.loadtxt('/root/catkin_ws/src/ocr/dataset/generalsamples.data',np.float32)
6 responses = np.loadtxt('/root/catkin_ws/src/ocr/dataset/generalresponses.data',np.float32)
7 responses = responses.reshape((responses.size,1))
8 
9 model = cv2.ml.KNearest_create()
10 model.train(samples,cv2.ml.ROW_SAMPLE,responses)
11 save_dir = '/root/catkin_ws/src/ocr/model/knn_trained_model.xml'
12 model.save(save_dir)
13 
14 
15 # testing
16 num_dir = 0
17 while num_dir < 10:
18  num = 0
19  while num < 100:
20  name = '/root/catkin_ws/src/ocr/dataset/' + str(num_dir) + '/' + str(num) + '.jpg'
21  img = cv2.imread(name, cv2.IMREAD_GRAYSCALE)
22 
23  #out = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_GRAY2BGR)
24  out = np.zeros(img.shape,np.uint8)
25  #gray = cv2.cvtColor(im,cv2.COLOR_BGR2GRAY)
26  #thresh = cv2.adaptiveThreshold(img,255,1,1,3,2)
27 
28  (thresh, bin_img) = cv2.threshold(img, 127, 255, cv2.THRESH_BINARY)
29 
30 
31  contours,hierarchy = cv2.findContours(bin_img,cv2.RETR_LIST,cv2.CHAIN_APPROX_SIMPLE)
32 
33  for cnt in contours:
34  if cv2.contourArea(cnt)>20:
35  [x,y,w,h] = cv2.boundingRect(cnt)
36  if h>20:
37  cv2.rectangle(img,(x,y),(x+w,y+h),(0,255,0),2)
38  roi = bin_img[y:y+h,x:x+w]
39  #cv2.imshow('roi',roi)
40  roismall = cv2.resize(roi,(10,10))
41  cv2.imshow('roismall',roismall)
42  roismall = roismall.reshape((1,100))
43  roismall = np.float32(roismall)
44 
45  retval, results, neigh_resp, dists = model.findNearest(roismall, k = 3)
46  string = str(int((results[0][0])))
47  print(string)
48  cv2.putText(out,string,(x,y+h),0,1,(255,255,255))
49 
50  #cv2.imshow('out',out)
51  #cv2.waitKey(0)
52 
53  cv2.imshow('img',img)
54  cv2.imshow('out',out)
55  cv2.waitKey(0)
56 
57  num = num+1
58  num_dir = num_dir + 1
